content.question: A store sells three different products. The price of the products, in increasing order, can be represented by the <math alttext="1 by 3"><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>3</mn></math> matrix <math alttext="A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. For sales on a certain day, <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> represents the number of <math alttext="$ 12.50"><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></math>-priced products sold, <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> represents the number of <math alttext="$ 17.00"><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></math>-priced products sold, and <math alttext="z"><mi>z</mi></math> represents the number of <math alttext="$ 18.25"><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></math>-priced products sold. Which of the following gives the total amount of sales, in dollars, for those three products on that day?

choices.label: <math alttext="The product of two matrices. A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25. A three by one matrix with components x and y and z."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>z</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="The product of two matrices. A three by one matrix with components x and y and z. A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>z</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="The product of two matrices. A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25. A three by one matrix with components x and y and z."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>z</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="The product of two matrices. A three by one matrix with components x and y and z. A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>z</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="The product of two matrices. A one by three matrix with components $12.50 and $17.00 and $18.25. A three by one matrix with components x and y and z."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>12.50</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>17.00</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>$</mo><mn>18.25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>z</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
